definition: (TCM) the three truncal cavities (thoracic, abdominal and pelvic), known as the "triple heater" or "San Jiao"

sentences.english: Triple energizer has no exterior-interior relationships with the zang-organs, it is therefore called "solitary fu-organ".
sentences.chinese: 三焦和髒之間沒有表裏關係，因此也稱爲“孤腑”。

sentences.english: Even the heat-draining method was developed into qi-blood and triple burner patterns.
sentences.chinese: 以氣分血分及上中下三焦劃分瀉熱法，等等。

sentences.english: In the theory of TCM the term "triple warmer" is also used to locate the body parts.
sentences.chinese: 在中醫理論中，三焦也是劃分軀體部位的一個概念。

sentences.english: Shao Changrong, the famous expert of TCM, can use triple warmer separating therapy to treat turbid phlegm cough.
sentences.chinese: 名中醫邵長榮教授應用三焦辨證法治療痰濁咳嗽。

definition: (TCM) six bowels (hollow organs), namely: gall bladder 膽|胆[dan3], stomach 胃[wei4], large intestine 大腸|大肠[da4 chang2], small intestine 小腸|小肠[xiao3 chang2], triple heater 三焦[san1 jiao1], bladder 膀胱[pang2 guang1]
one of the channels of TCM
five viscera of TCM, namely: heart 心[xin1], liver 肝[gan1], spleen 脾[pi2], lungs 肺[fei4] and kidneys 腎|肾[shen4]
half outside, half inside/half interior, half exterior
spleen and stomach (digestive organs in TCM)/preferences/one's taste (e.g. in literature)
bladder 氣|气[qi4] transformation in TCM
